column4: I type in service networking start, and it comes back 'stop/waiting'. - wtf does that mean?
what's wrong with 'what the foolishness'?
I type in service networking start, and it comes back 'stop/waiting'. - what the heck does that mean?
did you run it under sudo?
- yep
and you ran service networking stop first?
- 'service networking stop' -> unknown instance
well, there you go... now you're getting more detailed errors....
yeah... i guess not... so do the command and look for something that looks like an error....
lemme guess, you've recently made changes to your network card/settings, and now you're trying to get the machine back on the network?
- no, this all came about with me trying to remove X11/gnome
- so it's trying to run dhclient
omg.... yeah, that's a problem... have you tried booting to runlevel 3?
- inittab doesnt exist, where is default runlevel set?
that's a good question
/etc/init/rc-sysinit.conf
aunty google is my friend.
dude, man up and read, well, the.... man page on runlevel like hiku suggested
- I did.  I was just informing you that there's a env var in sysinit-rc
okay.... I thought you were asking about it...
- yes, the runlevel fixed it
nice...
- what config var tells it to run dhcp/client?  I have network/interfaces set, but its not using it
you're on your own at this point... I would do some research on "headless" ubuntu
